123951611.review: Alongside Dark Elf, this is one of the lewd RPGMaker games that made me appreciate RPGMaker games. Too bad it isn't on this platform anymore for some reason, but I am glad I got a copy.

117392898.review:
Holy shit... the localization.... It's like someone handed google translate a fifth of vodka to chug before putting it to work on this game. I still can't make sense of anything beyond the bare bones of the narrative. The one saving grace is that what you have to do to progress the story at any given point is pretty simple, so you can usually stumble your way through without any real difficulty. Unfortunately, the resulting lack of investment makes this modestly sized game feel agonizingly slow. Second is that there is a fair bit of dissonance between story and the BGM; a situation that varies between tense and downright dark should not sound upbeat or idyllic. The BGM isn't bad, in fact it's quite good, but it doesn't fit the game. The voices and SFX are at least basic - not bad, not good either, but they at least aren't clashing with the game. The UI is mercifully simple and (if you go down a certain path) the H comes quickly, easily, and is at least decent. The proportions on Alice are... odd. I can't really tell if her thighs are ripped or not, or if the shifting mass of them is simply a consequence of the art style *shrug*, nevertheless despite being rather trope-y, she's still fairly attractive and the CG quality is fine overall. The only direct complaint I can muster regarding the CGs is that they'll occasionally zoom in, but not increase the resolution, so it's VERY pixellated on such shots.

Despite my complaints the game is still decent and competently put together, so it gets the thumbs up, but this is one of those "get on sale" or "get if you've already got the better games and need something new" types.
6/10

86182208.review:
TL;DR: Give this game a pass unless you like the art and catch it on sale and are willing to go get the R18 patch from another site.

The art for this eroge is mostly good, though you do need to get the R18 patch elsewhere to remove the censoring.  It's also the main reason to get this game since it's pretty sub-par in every other respect except maybe voice work (and that's 90% moans).

Branching plot with a few different ends.  Not a ton of them, but a handful of reasonably different endings and paths to get there does give a little replay value.  However, since the translation is so terrible you only get the gist of things at best which makes the plot feel pretty generic even by H-game standards.

Sound is ok, what bits of voice are used are good enough to not be jarring though only two characters are voiced anyway, though since it's the the PC and the villain it doesn't feel too weird that they're the only voiced roles.

The RPG portions are very basic and silly-easy even on the higher difficulty, but they're also quick enough to get through or downright skippable enough to not bog things down if you don't want to get stuck in the grind (of the non-H kind).  However, they don't really add anything either and it often feels like the game could have been a Visual Novel instead and not lost much of anything.

It's also annoying that fullscreen mode is tucked away in a properties window from right-clicking on the top of the game's default window rather than a nice in game settings option, but at least it's there because otherwise it would feel like a game for ants at my typical resolution.

So overall, I'd say the game is maybe worth the low price (especially if you catch it on sale) but only for the art.  Otherwise, you can easily give it a pass.

70840011.review:
DON'T SUPPORT THIS SCUMMY PUBLISHER!

The heiress is a hrpg game made in RPG maker by a fairly good doujin circle ONEONE1. Unfortunately, it has been published by one of the worst possible publishers SakuraGame/Paradise Project. In effect, the localisation is horrible. The translation is on google translate level at best. Hence, the plot is very hard to follow, and often unintelligible.

The plot itself is pretty average even considering low budget. There are no unexpected twists or any deeper moments. 8 endings provide some variety but some of them are barely distinct. The main characters lack depth and some secondary ones have no backstory at all. They just are.

The art is objectively ok (some might like it), but subjectively (my opinion) is somewhat below average. The backgrounds and maps are good enough for this budget. There are a lot of CGs and even some simple animations, but not much variety. Lot of scenes but just like CGs, not much variety. Additionally, even with patch, all hCGs are mosaiced (with patch). This diminish enjoyment.

The music is forgettable. Sound effects are fine.

One scene causes game to crash, which is actually pretty good. A lot of doujin games have many more issues  than this one.

Overall, the game would be acceptable depending on your taste, but the horrendous localisation and censorship prevent me from recommending this title. 4/10

DON'T SUPPORT THIS SCUMMY PUBLISHER!

70670791.review:
[h1]QUICK FACTS[/h1]

Type: H-RPG (RPG Maker)
Developer: OneOne1
Publisher: Paradise Project
Price: 3,99€
Est. playtime: 6-8 hours
Censorship: yes (patch online available)


[h1]THE GAME[/h1]

[b]MECHANICS[/b]
RPG Maker in OneOne1 style: your MC is based in a village/city where you can freely roam around. There’s no overland map; instead you get missions that unlock new dungeon areas where you can fast travel to. Completing missions progresses the story in a mostly linear fashion. 

On normal difficulty, most of your time is spent fighting in dungeons. [b]Combat[/b] is basic, very easy and quite repetitive. You can either grind random mobs for XP or get killed by them every so often (which teleports you back to town and gives you a level for free). Boss fights may be a bit of a challenge if you get to them too quickly. Items and skills are somewhat useful, but mindlessly bashing the attack button and the odd heal gets the job done too.

Controls: Keyboard only. Use Ctrl to fast forward dialogue.

[b]STORY[/b]
You play as Alice Dietrich, the sole heir of the noble Dietrich family. Your father’s death left you with a sizeable family debt, which you to need repay.  Luckily, you’ve been trained as a gunner knight, which allows you to perform quests for money in service of the kingdom.

There are three main story routes: [spoiler]succeed at everything and remain a knight, fail to pay your debts in time and become a slave, or turn evil yourself[/spoiler]. Between these routes, multiple endings are available. The outcome largely depends on whether you succeed at certain missions or not. 

[b]QUALITY[/b]
As a game, The Heiress is a pretty lousy product. The story is shallow and predictable, the gameplay is way too easy to offer any added value, and the translation is a bug-ridden pile of rubbish. Some scenes may actually crash the game due to localization errors; you may need to change the language temporarily in order to get past them. 

The game does offer some replay value due to the different story routes. However, that’d require you to go through all of the above again.


[h1]THE GOODS[/h1]

[b]SUBJECT[/b]
The lewd in The Heiress is mostly about Alice’s sexual (mis)adventures, which at first mostly happen against her will. But as is customary with these type of games, she may end up becoming perverted enough to enjoy it and even take the initiative. In addition, there are a couple of scenes featuring other NPC’s.

Keywords: [spoiler]bondage, big breasts, group, fluids, forced, humiliation, milking, monster, public, solo, straight, tentacles, urination[/spoiler]


[b]CONTENT[/b]
44 scenes made of static CG’s, as well as short (combat) animations supported by rudimentary voice acting. 

[b]ACCESS[/b]
It’s possible to finish the game without hardly seeing any lewd at all, if [spoiler]you succeed at all of your missions[/spoiler]. However, once you [spoiler]have lost your virginity and fail to pay your debts[/spoiler], you’ll come across most of the scenes in the game.

Combat animations get unlocked once you lose your virginity. Once you complete the game, you’ll get the option to unlock the full gallery in subsequent playthroughs.

Censorship: Visuals are censored by default, and there’s no patch available from the developer. However, [url= https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VGmlC696yfs]this gentleman[/url] explains how to get one for free. 

[b]QUALITY[/b]
The lewd in this game is actually pretty good: high quality (albeit at a somewhat dated resolution), varied and a fairly large amount of scenes. Animations are rather crude and will look familiar if you’ve played other OneOne1 games, but they’re a nice extra.


[h1]VERRO’S VERDICT[/h1]

The Heiress is one of those games you should only consider buying for the lewd. As with many other games from this developer/publisher combo, the gameplay and localization will probably annoy you more than they’ll entertain you. It’s very cheap though, so if you’re on a tight budget and you enjoy this type of content…  But don’t say I didn’t warn you.

[i]Looking for fairly priced adult games with good gameplay? Follow my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38781731-Chez-Verro/]curator page![/url][/i]

+ Graficos rpg de los que me gustan.
+ Cromos de Steam
+ Barato

Lo peor
+ Música meh!
+ La traducción no esta completa y a veces se pierde información de la trama.
+ Los esbirros malos son los mas idiotas de todos los juegos que he jugado en mi vida.
+ Quizas poca variedad en las habilidades de personaje.

Conclusión final:
La trama esta genial y las escenas eróticas son buenas y variadas, diferentes finales, diferentes decisiones, si te pasas el juego puedes continuar con tu pj por otra ruta de elecciones, puedes subirle la dificultad y lo puedes pillar barato en rebajas... que mas quieres.
Compralo, échale unas horas y rejuégalo y ya si eso, puedes desistalarlo hasta que te pique el gusanillo de volver a explorarlo.

At point i imagined that the game developer thought "hey my kid is 6 years old he has english classes so he can translate the game"
Now you might think ....so? there is alot of 6 year old kids that have really nice written and spoken english :p

"The Heiress" is your typical "RPG Maker" H-game and follows the same story beats of Oneone1's other H-games, most notably "Dark Elf Historia" (Which I played outside of steam).The translation is as spotty as a monochromatic dalmatian and the mental gymnastics one must undertake in order to make sense of the plot let alone what happens during the actual...umm.."scenes" is an undertaking I do not recommend for those who take pride in English grammar...

I'm conflicted on recommending it because I'd love to see more stuff coming to the west, but no right-minded person should support such an abyssmal effort.

Incidentally the game is riddled with bugs due to the machine translation altering much of the triggers from firing due to flipping slashes around in the script files.

And no, you can't fix it because Oneone1 encrypt's his scripts.

34484846.review:
*Ahem*

ONEONE1 is known for making good Ero-RPGs.
SakuraGame is known for making the worst translations in recorded modern history.

When combined, sadly not even the quality of ONEONE1's handicraft can save their own game, because the translation ruins everything. The game works, but the language is so bad that you more often than not have to actually guess what's being said. It's frustrating and takes quite a toll on the player. This is because SakuraGame relies entirely on machine translation, and most likely doesn't even know English language themselves. When a language is directly translated, as machine translation do, it often doesn't make very much sense because idioms and sentence structure isn't the same in different languages. You need human skills and intelligence to make sense of it all, and make it into something that relays the same message. 

SakuraGame doesn't do that, and ONEONE1 knows, but they still asked them to translate the game instead of someone with actual translation skills. Why? Who knows, maybe ONEONE1 doesn't really care much for gaijins, but still want our money, and SakuraGame works cheap and fast? It's hard to say. No matter, the fact still remains that "The Heiress" has language that's so bad that it completely destroys what's good about the game.

EDIT: The in-battle H-attacks doesn't work in the Steam version. It's probably broken because of the translation work, and it's still not fixed. This game just might become the first Steam game that makes me ever want to ask for a refund.

ONEONE1: Please choose a better translator in the future, or go away from Steam and never come back.

34324677.review:
Ok, besides the norms for the game, here are a couple of matters that you want to know.

1.  To hide this game from other users, the following instructions from IGN are recommended (work safe):
http://www.ign.com/articles/2014/08/08/you-can-now-hide-embarrassing-games-from-your-steam-library

Hiding games doesn't forbid you from playing them, you can access by clicking in Your Library, then Games, and then at the botton, you will see your filter for hidden games that you can call up in the menu.

2.  You should visit the Discussions page and check for the latest patches.  Steam has a policy regarding certain content, and while the game is perfectly fine as sold in the store, there's some value-added content that you may want to install that is obviously posted as a sticky in the Discussions.  

While the developer probably does not speak English as a native language, he/she is very enthusiastic about support, and seems to have someone translating into the native language for support.  

As for the game, it fulfills every expectation that you would have for this genre.  The plain game is probably rated R, the extra content puts this game in other territory.

I bought this game fair and square, I did NOT receive a promotional copy, I want to see more of these games on Steam in the future.  There is a dark humor to be had with all of these games, and as such, YMMV on the content, but the game is good for the genre.

34269872.review:
Buy this if you have a lot of patience with the translation, or if you're decently fluent in reading Japanese with a decent grasp of understanding it when you hear it.

The gameplay is less of a goal to get porked, and more of a goal to be "What if a normal JRPG had consequences where sometimes the enemy takes your hoo-hah if you lose." So it's more than some internet pronz game, less than a well polished JRPG.

The Japanese version makes a LOT more sense. But again, you might not understand it. I do, so I enjoy it.

Mechanics-wise the battles are very easy if you fight decently. I've found that I level up even without fighting too much. The combat really isn't the bread and butter of the game.

What IS, is the H-System. Each smexy times action that successfully happens to your character builds up a system. If things happen enough times your character developes certain attitude adjustments. She starts off an honorable uptight warrior of justice but if enough things happen to her she developes to enjoy or not enjoy certain things. Not something I was expecting to happen.

Unfortunately the English translation is so terrible that I only recommend it if you're willing to skip that, or if you can understand a bit of Japanese.

I'd rate this 8/10, decent priced and provides some hours of gameplay.

Pros:
- English translations are a comedy to read.
- Multiple endings.
- Easy combat.
- Nice "art".

Cons:
- This early version has minor bugs.

34188913.review: Another awesome game by ONEONE1 unfortunately with same problems as previous (Dark Elf) - bad translation and crashing with errors on some scenes

34180147.review:
Let's get the positive out of the way first. I like Alice's design, she's pretty cute.

Then the usual. Compared to previous SakuraGame releases, the translation is even worse. I can't stress this enough, trying to make out what everything means is painful, as opposed to Dark Elf or Material Girl where it was really badly translated and goofy at points.
Also, the localization has actually broken the game. We'll get back to that later.

So, what else? Like Dark Elf, you have pretty generic JRPG system, that is easy as fuck. Even if you continiously select basic attack while fighting normal enemies, it is impossible to lose, since they do so little damage, and gaining levels heals you completely, which you do fast enough to negate any damage that you might get. The only challenge seems to be in boss fights, where you either find out the weakness for fast kill, or heal yourself every few turns. It really is easy as fuck, and makes you wonder why there even is combat here.
How about porn? Good news is that unlike Dark Elf, you don't need to lose to get sex-scenes here, it seems to be based on player choices in the story. Bad news is that some of them crash the game. I'm not even joking, this is what happened to me during the first sex-scene of the game.
https://puu.sh/x7Qb3/1df918a006.jpg

And really, the whole game is the same bullshit, but even more annoying to read through compared to previous releases, so I'm not really planning to play any more.
If you absolutely need RPG Maker porn, play something else. Even Dark Elf would be better choice, but I strongly advice looking for something else, not released by SakuraGame.
